title: Llyn Eiddwen Walking Route

images.title: Ian Medcalf / Llyn Eiddwen
images.caption: Llyn Eiddwen with Castell Tredwell(folly)just visible in the trees on the small peninsula.

images.title: Jason.nlw, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A View of Llyn Eiddwen in Ceredigion. The lakebed is a NNR and the surrounding land is an SSSI

images.title: Nigel Brown / The northern end of Llyn Eiddwen
images.caption: The northern end of the lake. Taken on a day with a cold wind blasting down the llyn, as the waves testify.

images.title: Nigel Brown / Cattle grid on Mynydd Bach
images.caption: Cattle grid on Mynydd Bach. Marks the start of the open grazing above Trefenter.

images.title: Ian Medcalf / Mynydd Bach
images.caption: Triangulation pillar on the summit of Mynydd Bach near Trefenter

images.title: Nigel Brown / Grazing on Mynydd Bach
images.caption: Grazing on Mynydd Bach. One of the few bits of grazing land on this part of Mynydd Bach; the rest is forestry.

description: This circular walk takes you around near Llyn Eiddwen in Ceredigion. The remote lake is also nature reserve with rare plants and wildlife to see. Look out for otters and voles as you make your way through the area. You can follow bridleways and country lanes around the lake with views of the surrounding common land. Hafod Ithel and Mynydd Bach lie to the north with fine views towards the coast at Cardigan Bay to enjoy.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To the east there's the splendid Cors Caron Nature Reserve to explore. The reserve includes boardwalks taking you to raised bogs with surrounding reedbeds, grasslands, woodland, rivers, streams and ponds.

display_address: Llangwyryfon, Ceredigion, Cymru / Wales, SY23 4JJ, United Kingdom
